title: Graphic Map-Based Simulation Program for Computer-Assisted Probability Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational statistics concepts and comprehension of probability terminology
context.additional_context: Learners experience probability problem-solving processes in dynamic graphic map environments using VR devices, receiving real-time feedback via formative assessments. Learning materials integrate static and dynamic visual elements

learning_goals: Learners can solve probability problems with 85% accuracy using graphic maps (static/static motion cues/computer animation/interactive animation).
Learners generate a thinking process using visual notes (images and movement symbols) in a simulation environment to analyze complex probability problems.
Learners solve transfer problems presented with static graphics alone with a success rate of at least 75%.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
